column4: im trying to share the printer an hp psc 1110 over a network with two computers. the computer the printers hooked up to is a windows vista home pc. im trying to share it to this pc running ubuntu 8.04.

ive installed samba, samba-common, smbfs. ive configured it and set the vista pc to share files and printers. the printer receives test pages sent to it but doesnt print them. they show up in the job list saying spooling and the printer physically tries to print them, but to no effect.
i dont know if you tried this, but can you give hplip a shot?
not the one in the repos, the one from hp
hplip is something like cups for hp printers
try the ones from hp, not the ones in the repo. newer version .run file
yea, unless doing a hplip.run --help and it shows options
is there a deb package for hplip from hp?
no, only a .run file that has the latest version 2.8.9
ok i see. what about this dynamic link? what am i supposed to put there?
dont put nothing and see how it goes
still no luck even with hplip 2.89?
not yet. this is everything ive done til now http://rafb.net/p/EADtgD99.html
where does hplip and the firewall collide?
